messages.subject: Re: Help suggestions to see how other unschoolers are doing it
messages.msgSnippet: I apologize if my question was unappropriate it was not ment to be. Thanks for the advice. ... to
messages.messageBody:
I apologize if my question was unappropriate it was not ment to be.
Thanks for the advice.


--- In AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com, Sandra Dodd <Sandra@...> wrote:
>
> The best way to see how other unschoolers are doing it is probably
to
> read the archives of the list (go to yahoogroups.com and you can get
> there, and to follow some of the links from here:
> http://sandradodd.com/help
>
> Those go to lots of articles for beginners (your mom might enjoy
> reading some of that) and to other people's unschooling sites and
> blogs and photos.
>
> There are some other discussion lists there too that might be more
> appropriate.
>
> Sandra
>

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Help suggestions to see how other unschoolers are doing it
messages.msgSnippet: ... Aside from the obvious, learn to get by with less, I was able to find work at night when my dh was home with the kids. I was home during the day when he
messages.messageBody:
On Nov 7, 2006, at 12:30 PM, Tiffany wrote:

> I just feel like I am missing out on so much I
> just wanted suggestions to see how other unschoolers are doing it.

Aside from the obvious, learn to get by with less, I was able to find
work at night when my dh was home with the kids. I was home during
the day when he was at work.

-pam

Unschooling shirts, cups, bumper stickers, bags...
Live Love Learn
UNSCHOOL!
<http://www.cafepress.com/livelovelearn>





[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Help suggestions to see how other unschoolers are doing it
messages.msgSnippet: The best way to see how other unschoolers are doing it is probably to read the archives of the list (go to yahoogroups.com and you can get there, and to follow
messages.messageBody:
The best way to see how other unschoolers are doing it is probably to
read the archives of the list (go to yahoogroups.com and you can get
there, and to follow some of the links from here:
http://sandradodd.com/help

Those go to lots of articles for beginners (your mom might enjoy
reading some of that) and to other people's unschooling sites and
blogs and photos.

There are some other discussion lists there too that might be more
appropriate.

Sandra

messages.subject: Help suggestions to see how other unschoolers are doing it
messages.msgSnippet: Hello. My husband & I have been working & my mom stays with my kids who are 9 & 3yrs. She s great and although she does not agree with our choice she respects
messages.messageBody:
Hello. My husband & I have been working & my mom stays with my kids who
are 9 & 3yrs. She's great and although she does not agree with our
choice she respects it. I just feel like I am missing out on so much I
just wanted suggestions to see how other unschoolers are doing it.
Thanks for your time.
